anonymous_Uid.local_definition: A unique identifier for the patient, anonymized to protect privacy. This UID represents the patient's identification and is common across hospitals in the network. It is system generated and not visible to the patient or clinicians.

anonymous_mrno.local_definition: Anonymized medical record number of the patient. This number is specific to the patient's medical record number in the specific hospital and is used for tracking visits. It is visible to the users of the system and is used by clinicians to track visits, diagnosis, history etc of the patient.

sh_history_code.local_definition: The name of the disease as reported by the patient and noted in the systemic history during initial examination.

sh_duration.local_definition: The number of days, months or years which the patient has reported having the disease in the systemic history. Temporal field, but not Datetime.

sh_prescription.local_definition: Denotes whether the disease reported in the systemic history is being treated via a prescription medicine. Boolean value, 0 or 1.

sh_medicine.local_definition: The name of the medicine that is being used to treat the condition reported in the Systemic History. Located from a fixed vocabulary, but can also be mentioned in the drugdesc field.

sh_non_ocular_sx.local_definition: Type of non ocular surgery done as part of systemic history

sh_non_ocular_sx_duration.local_definition: Number of days, months or years since the non ocular surgery.

bh_consanguinous_parents.local_definition: Indicates whether the patient has consanguinous parents. If the value is non-null, indicates that there is consanguinity, and the value indicates the level of it. Note: Birth history is generally noted only for minor patients.

bh_gestation_period.local_definition: Gestation period at birth of the patient, indicates if it was a premature birth. Format #weeks.

bh_mode_of_delivery.local_definition: Mode of delivery, whether C-section or natural birth of the patient.

bh_birthweight.local_definition: Weight at birth noted as per the Birth History, of the patient. Format #lbs

oh_procedure_type.local_definition: Procedure or surgery or medication taken in the past.

oh_procedure_name.local_definition: Name of past procedure, surgery, medication

oh_procedure_date.local_definition: Date of past procedure, surgery or medication

oh_procedure_laterality.local_definition: Eye Laterality related to the procedure.

sch_consanginous_parents.local_definition: Indicates whether the patient has consanguinous parents. If the value is non-null, indicates that there is consanguinity, and the value indicates the grade.

sch_marital_status.local_definition: Indicates the marital status of the patient. Values can be single, married, unreported.

sch_smoking.local_definition: Indicates the smoking habit of the patient. Its a temporal value. A null value indicates non smoker, and a non null indicates level of smoking: occasional, heavy or chain.

sch_alcohol.local_definition: Indicates the alcohol intake of the patient. A null value indicates no alcohol consumption, a non null value indicates level of consumption.

peid.local_definition: Unique identifier for patient encounters or visits. A PE is a patient event, and it means a visit to the hospital, which can be a fresh visit, a routine followup or a visit for a procedure.

pedate.local_definition: The date of the patient encounter or visit.

complaint_name.local_definition: A coded name for the patient complaint. The complaint is a set of vocabulary fields that are filled in the patient record by the initial examiner.

sub_complaint.local_definition: There are further information points about each complaint. Further data points about the complaint.

sub_complaint_value.local_definition: Each complaint_qualifier has a list of coded values. This field is filled from that list.

complaint_duration.local_definition: A temporal value suggesting how many days, years or months the patient has had this complaint.

as_part_name.local_definition: Part of the anterior segment this value refers to. Has fixed values in the vocabulary

schema_reconstruction.class_label: Anterior Segment Exam (as - refers to Anterior Segment examination)
schema_reconstruction.aesthetic_label: Anterior Segment Exam (as - refers to Anterior Segment examination)

as_laterality.local_definition: This field indicates the laterality of the eye this exam refers to.

fe_part_name.local_definition: Part of the fundus this refers to. Has fixed coded values in the values list. The values are 'Media', 'Disc', 'Vessels', 'Background Retina' and 'Macula/Foveal Reflex'.

schema_reconstruction.class_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination )
schema_reconstruction.aesthetic_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination )

schema_reconstruction.class_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination ) Variables
schema_reconstruction.aesthetic_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination ) Variables

fe_part_laterality.local_definition: This field indicates the laterality of the eye this exam refers to.

schema_reconstruction.class_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination )
schema_reconstruction.aesthetic_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination )

schema_reconstruction.class_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination ) Variables
schema_reconstruction.aesthetic_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination ) Variables

fe_finding.local_definition: Name of issue found in this part. Has fixed values in the vocabulary for each one of the fundus parts.

schema_reconstruction.class_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination )
schema_reconstruction.aesthetic_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination )

schema_reconstruction.class_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination ) Variables
schema_reconstruction.aesthetic_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination ) Variables

fe_value_1.local_definition: This is the numerical value of the finding with a fixed vocabulary for each finding. Unit values are defined in the vocabulary for each finding.

schema_reconstruction.class_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination )
schema_reconstruction.aesthetic_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination )

schema_reconstruction.aesthetic_label: Fundus Exam ( fe - refers to fundus examination ) Variables

vision_curr_glass_duration.local_definition: number of months since patient has been wearing glasses.

vision_type.local_definition: Corrected Vision ( Visual Acuity ) / Uncorrected Vision ( Visual Acuity)

vision_type_of_chart.local_definition: Type of chart used to check vision ( Snellen/ Logmar)

RESP_DV.local_definition: Right Eye Spherical Equivalent for distance vision, in diopters.

RECY_DV.local_definition: Right Eye Cylinder value for distance vision, indicating astigmatism.

REAxis_DV.local_definition: Right Eye Axis for distance vision, indicating the orientation of astigmatism in degrees (D)

REVA_DV.local_definition: Right Eye Visual Acuity for distance vision.

Rephva_DV.local_definition: Right Eye Presenting Visual Acuity for distance vision.

REBCVA_DV.local_definition: Left Eye Best Corrected Visual Acuity for distance vision.

LESP_DV.local_definition: Left Eye Spherical Equivalent for distance vision.

LECY_DV.local_definition: Left Eye Cylinder value for distance vision, indicating astigmatism.

LEAxis_DV.local_definition: Left Eye Axis for distance vision, indicating the orientation of astigmatism.

LEVA_DV.local_definition: Left Eye Visual Acuity for distance vision.

LEPhva_DV.local_definition: Left Eye Presenting Visual Acuity for distance vision.

Leucva_DV.local_definition: Left Eye best Corrected Visual Acuity for distance vision.

REMPD_DV.local_definition: Right Eye Mean Pupil Diameter for distance vision measure in mm.

LEMPD_DV.local_definition: Left Eye Mean Pupil Diameter for distance vision.

BPCystole.local_definition: Systolic blood pressure measurement  in mm Hg at the time of examination.

BPDiastole.local_definition: Diastolic blood pressure measurement  in mm Hg at the time of examination.

BSStatus.local_definition: Blood sugar status or level at the time of examination in mg/dL

investigation_name.local_definition: Name of the investigation performed. Codes from a vocabulary

investigation_laterality.local_definition: Laterality of the eye the investigation was performed on.

ocular_nonocular.local_definition: Indicates whether this is an ocular investigation or not. Examples of non ocular investigations are Blood Pressure measurement.

investigation_date.local_definition: Date and time when the investigation was performed

special_investigation_name.local_definition: Name of the investigation performed. These are mostly imaging studies.

eye_laterality.local_definition: This field indicates the laterality of the eye this exam refers to.

special_investigation_date.local_definition: Date and time when the investigation was performed

special_investigation_id.local_definition: Scan_id ( Study id ) of the investigation performed. Typically the id of the DICOM file or image file of this investigation.

special_investigation_notes.local_definition: Remarks or Notes about the results of the investigation

diagnosis_name.local_definition: Name of the diagnosis given to the patient

refractive_correction_type.local_definition: Refractive Correction Advised. Example (Same Gp, Lasik Counselling, Contact Lens)

anesthesia.local_definition: Whether to be done under anesthesia or not

procedure_type.local_definition: Procedure type ( eg Injection, laser etc ) advised

procedure_name.local_definition: Exact name of the procedure advised

treatment_type.local_definition: Treatment type. ( eg : Exercise, Patching, Lacriminal Sac Massage etc)

treatment_duration.local_definition: Duration of treatment in days, months etc.

scan_id ( StudyInstanceUid).local_definition: Typically the Study Instance Uid of the DICOM field

anonymized patient id.local_definition: Anonymized Patient Id associated with the image.

visit_id.local_definition: Unique identifier for patient encounters or visits. A PE is a patient event, and it means a visit to the hospital, which can be a fresh visit, a routine followup or a visit for a procedure.

device_type.local_definition: The type of OCT device. This will typically be the Manufacturer + Model

image_id.local_definition: Typically, the Image Instance Uid of the DICOM image. Each study can have many images.

number_of_frames.local_definition: Number of frames captured in this image. Each image can have many frames.

frame_id.local_definition: Identification of the slice. Corresponds to the id of the actual image slice.

Pixel Spacing.local_definition: Dimensions of each pixel in mm/µm

Image Position (Patient).local_definition: Origin Location (top-left corner coordinates) of B-Scan slice in 3D space

scan_id.local_definition: Typically the Study Instance Uid of the DICOM field. Here, the locator for the Pentacam image files.

K1 (Flat Keratometry).local_definition: Radius/curvature of the flattest corneal meridian (anterior surface)

K2 (Steep Keratometry).local_definition: Radius/curvature of the steepest corneal meridian (anterior surface)

Posterior K1/K2/Km.local_definition: Same as above but for posterior corneal surface

Thinnest Corneal Thickness.local_definition: Minimum corneal thickness detected across cornea

Anterior Chamber Depth (ACD).local_definition: Distance from corneal endothelium to lens

Anterior Chamber Volume (ACV).local_definition: Total fluid-filled space volume between cornea & lens

Anterior Elevation Map.local_definition: Height difference of anterior cornea vs. best-fit sphere

Posterior Elevation Map.local_definition: Height difference of posterior cornea vs. best-fit sphere

Corneal Volume (CV).local_definition: Total corneal volume in defined diameter (e.g., 10 mm)

Belin/Ambrosio Deviation (BAD-D).local_definition: Composite ectasia index (combines curvature, pachymetry, elevation)

Lens Densitometry.local_definition: Optical density within defined regions of crystalline lens

ISV (Index of Surface Variance).local_definition: Standard deviation of individual corneal curvature values

IVA (Index of Vertical Asymmetry).local_definition: Compares superior vs inferior corneal curvature

KI (Keratoconus Index).local_definition: Ratio between steepest radius and average curvature

CKI (Central Keratoconus Index).local_definition: Ratio of central vs paracentral corneal curvature

Q-value (Asphericity).local_definition: Describes whether cornea is prolate or oblate
